dt: {bc}being in a state of {a_link|balance} {bc}having different parts or elements properly or effectively arranged, proportioned, regulated, considered, etc.

dt.t: a {wi}balanced{/wi} diet
a {wi}balanced{/wi} blend of ingredients
{wi}balanced{/wi} flavors
a football team with a {wi}balanced{/wi} offense
providing a {wi}balanced{/wi} solution
a fair and {wi}balanced{/wi} assessment
trying to lead a more {wi}balanced{/wi} life
a {wi}balanced{/wi} budget {gloss}=a budget in which total revenues equal or exceed total expenses{/gloss}

shortdef: being in a state of balance : having different parts or elements properly or effectively arranged, proportioned, regulated, considered, etc.

cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}to poise or arrange in or as if in {d_link|balance|balance:1}

dt.t: {it}balancing{/it} a book on her head
The legislature hasn't {it}balanced{/it} the budget in years.
I struggled to {wi}balance{/wi} my career and family life.
a {it}balanced{/it} diet

dt: {bc}to bring to a state or position of balance {dx_def}see {dxt|balance:1||2}{/dx_def}

dt.t: {it}balanced{/it} the scales by adding a little more on one side

dt: {bc}to compute the difference between the debits and credits of (an account)

dt.t: {it}balancing{/it} a company's books
sent a check to {wi}balance{/wi} her account

dt: {bc}to arrange so that one set of elements exactly equals another

dt.t: {wi}balance{/wi} a mathematical equation

dt: {bc}to complete (a chemical equation) so that the same number of atoms and electric charges of each kind appears on each side

dt.t: He served black coffee to help {wi}balance{/wi} out the sweetness of the dessert.
{wi}balance{/wi} one consideration against another

dt: {bc}to equal or equalize in weight, number, or proportion

dt.t: The good times {it}balanced{/it} the bad times.

dt: {bc}to weigh in or as if in a balance {dx_def}see {dxt|balance:1||6}{/dx_def}

dt.t: {wi}balance{/wi} the profit and loss to see what had been gained
Try {it}balancing{/it} on one foot.
The good times and bad times {it}balanced{/it} out.
His speed will likely {wi}balance{/wi} out his competitor's greater strength.
The discount and the shipping charge {wi}balance{/wi} each other out.
{wi}balances{/wi} and temporizes on matters that demand action

shortdef: to poise or arrange in or as if in balance
to bring into harmony or proportion
to bring to a state or position of balance

dt: {bc}nicely or evenly balanced, arranged, or regulated

dt.t: a {wi}well-balanced{/wi} diet
a {wi}well-balanced{/wi} attack in football

shortdef: nicely or evenly balanced, arranged, or regulated

dt: {bc}to make (a different or opposite thing) less powerful, noticeable, etc. {bc}to compensate for

dt.t: Serve black coffee to help {it}balance out{/it} the sweetness of the dessert.
His quickness will {it}balance out{/it} the other fighter's greater strength.

dt: {bc}to be or become equal or even

dt.t: The good times and the bad times {it}balanced out{/it}

shortdef: to make (a different or opposite thing) less powerful, noticeable, etc. : to compensate for
to be or become equal or even

dt: used in various phrases to refer to a dangerous position or a position in which two different things are carefully balanced

dt.t: He's a thrill-seeker who likes living {phrase}on the razor's edge{/phrase}.
The country's future is {phrase}balanced on a razor's edge{/phrase}.
He {phrase}walks a/the razor edge{/phrase} between humor and bad taste in his comedy.

shortdef: —used in various phrases to refer to a dangerous position or a position in which two different things are carefully balanced
